section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: These regulations prescribe the objectives and investment policy of the Maryland Venture Fund, and the eligibility requirements, criteria, procedures and guidelines for investment by the Maryland Venture Fund.

section.heading: Objective.
section.text: Through the Maryland Venture Fund, TEDCO seeks to support the State’s innovation and entrepreneurship environment by investing in opportunities that will have the potential to:

para.text: Generate financial returns to sustain the investment programs that constitute the Maryland Venture Fund; and
Foster economic growth throughout the State.
In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Enterprise Fund” means the investment program established by §10-469 of the Act.
“Invest Maryland Program” means the investment program established under §§10-4A-01—10-4A-28 of the Act.
“Maryland Venture Fund” means the Enterprise Fund and the Invest Maryland Program.

section.heading: Investment Philosophy and Types of Qualified Businesses.
section.text: TEDCO seeks to invest in businesses that have demonstrated financial success and continued growth potential appropriate for subsequent venture investments.

section.heading: Eligibility.
section.text: TEDCO shall be satisfied that the applicant meets the requirements under COMAR 14.04.02.04.

section.heading: Investment Criteria.
section.text: In General. In addition to the investment criteria set forth in 14.04.02.05, TEDCO shall consider the following investment criteria:

para.text: Whether the market opportunity is appropriate for venture-stage investment;
Whether the applicant, at the time it submits an application to TEDCO, is raising a minimum investment round of $2 million;
Except for life sciences businesses, whether the applicant’s quarterly revenues equal or exceed $250,000;
Whether the investment has the potential to generate returns of two times the amount of TEDCO’s invested capital not more than 8 years from the date of the investment;
Whether the applicant presents a plausible exit strategy for investors;
Whether the applicant can provide access to or information about its partners and customers;
Whether the management team has the skills and ability to effectively secure an institutional venture investment or effectuate a successful exit for investors;
Whether the applicant has the potential to secure institutional venture capital from other investors concurrent with Maryland Venture Fund; and
Except for life science businesses, whether the applicant’s annual growth rate equals or exceeds 20 percent.

section.heading: Procedures and Guidelines for Investment Decisions.

para.text: In General. Except as provided in §§B and C of this regulation, TEDCO shall select businesses for investment by Maryland Venture Fund in accordance with the application process set forth in COMAR 14.04.02.
Enterprise Fund. For Enterprise Fund investments:
TEDCO may not acquire an ownership interest in a business that exceeds 25 percent of the business; and
Within 15 years of making the investment, TEDCO shall divest itself of the investment.

annotations.annotation: Economic Development Article, §§10-409 and 10-4A-27, Annotated Code of Maryland
